page.title: 19Tourism, Scoutmoor.
page.content: Part of the Rossendale Way path has been surfaced in concrete by the{North {West Water Authority}since this is the main means of vehicular access to Scoutmoor High Level Reservoir. From here there are fine views of the lower Rossendale Valley dominated by the Peel Monument and the valley of Dearden Brook. Across this valley the line of the dismantled tramway can be easily picked out. The path proceedes along the edge a pine woodland and then joins part of the original Bury Old Road known today as Micheal Wife Lane. This old highway then crosses Dearden Brook via a small footbridge. This stretch of the stream is well known as a local beauty spot, much used by families on a picnic outing.
